title: FFmpeg returned non-zero exit status 1
body:
## Environment Information

|Module|Version|
|-|-|
|`Video2X`|2.10.0|
|`FFmpeg`| N-95015-gba24b24aab|
|`waifu2x-caffe`||
|`waifu2x-converter-cpp`||
|`waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan`||

## Symptom

After extracting all the frames from a video it throws an exception. I've got everything up to date (including Python and NVIDIA drivers).

## Error Messages
```
C:\Users\simon\Desktop\video2x-master\bin>python video2x_gui.py
2019-09-22 13:24:36.525199 [+] INFO: Extracted frames are being saved to: D:\video2x\cache\tmp13z4ab3o
2019-09-22 13:24:36.526174 [+] INFO: Upscaled frames are being saved to: D:\video2x\cache\tmp0vhbapj6
2019-09-22 13:24:36.527189 [+] INFO: Executing: ['C:\\Users\\simon\\AppData\\Local\\video2x\\ffmpeg-latest-win64-static\\bin\\ffmpeg.exe', '-hwaccel', 'auto', '-y', '-i', 'C:\\Users\\simon\\Desktop\\sample_input.mp4', '-pix_fmt', 'rgba64be', 'D:\\video2x\\cache\\tmp13z4ab3o\\extracted_%0d.PNG']
ffmpeg version N-95015-gba24b24aab Copyright (c) 2000-2019 the FFmpeg developers
  built with gcc 9.2.1 (GCC) 20190918
  configuration: --enable-gpl --enable-version3 --enable-sdl2 --enable-fontconfig --enable-gnutls --enable-iconv --enable-libass --enable-libdav1d --enable-libbluray --enable-libfreetype --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libopencore-amrnb --enable-libopencore-amrwb --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopus --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx264 --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libzimg --enable-lzma --enable-zlib --enable-gmp --enable-libvidstab --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvo-amrwbenc --enable-libmysofa --enable-libspeex --enable-libxvid --enable-libaom --enable-libmfx --enable-ffnvcodec --enable-cuvid --enable-d3d11va --enable-nvenc --enable-nvdec --enable-dxva2 --enable-avisynth --enable-libopenmpt --enable-amf
  libavutil      56. 35.100 / 56. 35.100
  libavcodec     58. 58.101 / 58. 58.101
  libavformat    58. 33.100 / 58. 33.100
  libavdevice    58.  9.100 / 58.  9.100
  libavfilter     7. 58.102 /  7. 58.102
  libswscale      5.  6.100 /  5.  6.100
  libswresample   3.  6.100 /  3.  6.100
  libpostproc    55.  6.100 / 55.  6.100
Input #0, mov,mp4,m4a,3gp,3g2,mj2, from 'C:\Users\simon\Desktop\sample_input.mp4':
  Metadata:
    major_brand     : mp42
    minor_version   : 0
    compatible_brands: mp42mp41
    creation_time   : 2019-02-08T01:47:01.000000Z
  Duration: 00:00:19.07, start: 0.000000, bitrate: 1997 kb/s
    Stream #0:0(eng): Video: h264 (Main) (avc1 / 0x31637661), yuv420p(tv, smpte170m), 426x240, 1659 kb/s, 23.98 fps, 23.98 tbr, 24k tbn, 47.95 tbc (default)

      creation_time   : 2019-02-08T01:47:01.000000Z
      handler_name    : ?Mainconcept Video Media Handler
      encoder         : AVC Coding
    Stream #0:1(eng): Audio: aac (LC) (mp4a / 0x6134706D), 48000 Hz, stereo, fltp, 317 kb/s (default)
    Metadata:
      creation_time   : 2019-02-08T01:47:01.000000Z
      handler_name    : #Mainconcept MP4 Sound Media Handler
[h264 @ 0000016a434c6140] Using auto hwaccel type dxva2 with new default device.
Stream mapping:
  Stream #0:0 -> #0:0 (h264 (native) -> png (native))
Press [q] to stop, [?] for help
Output #0, image2, to 'D:\video2x\cache\tmp13z4ab3o\extracted_%0d.PNG':
  Metadata:
    major_brand     : mp42
    minor_version   : 0
    compatible_brands: mp42mp41
    encoder         : Lavf58.33.100
    Stream #0:0(eng): Video: png, rgba64be, 426x240, q=2-31, 200 kb/s, 23.98 fps, 23.98 tbn, 23.98 tbc (default)
    Metadata:
      creation_time   : 2019-02-08T01:47:01.000000Z
      handler_name    : ?Mainconcept Video Media Handler
      encoder         : Lavc58.58.101 png
frame=  456 fps= 25 q=-0.0 Lsize=N/A time=00:00:19.01 bitrate=N/A speed=1.04x
video:237173kB audio:0kB subtitle:0kB other streams:0kB global headers:0kB muxing overhead: unknown
Exception in thread Thread-1:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\simon\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\threading.py", line 926, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "C:\Users\simon\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\threading.py", line 870, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "video2x_gui.py", line 321, in _upscale
    self.upscaler.run()
  File "C:\Users\simon\Desktop\video2x-master\bin\upscaler.py", line 314, in run
    fm.extract_frames(self.input_video, self.extracted_frames)
  File "C:\Users\simon\Desktop\video2x-master\bin\ffmpeg.py", line 134, in extract_frames
    self._execute(execute)
  File "C:\Users\simon\Desktop\video2x-master\bin\ffmpeg.py", line 287, in _execute
    return subprocess.run(execute, shell=True, check=True).returncode
  File "C:\Users\simon\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\subprocess.py", line 487, in run
    output=stdout, stderr=stderr)
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['C:\\Users\\simon\\AppData\\Local\\video2x\\ffmpeg-latest-win64-static\\bin\\ffmpeg.exe', '-hwaccel', 'auto', '-y', '-i', 'C:\\Users\\simon\\Desktop\\sample_input.mp4', '-pix_fmt', 'rgba64be', 'D:\\video2x\\cache\\tmp13z4ab3o\\extracted_%0d.PNG']' returned non-zero exit status 1.
```
